New Records: This is the first time New Zealand have won a men's T20I match in Australia. They had lost the previous 3 matches, dating back to 2007.

For the first time in 11 years, New Zealand managed to beat Australia in Australia across any format of the game. New Zealand had played 11 matches and had lost 10 of them with their win before Saturday coming way back in 2011.
Biggest margin of defeat in terms of runs for Australia in T20Is. It is also the second biggest defeat for a full-time ICC member in T20 World Cups after England's 90-run defeat to India in 2012.
Devon Conway hit the highest score in T20Is against Australia in T20Is. Virat Kohli had held the record with his 90 in Australia in 2016.
Tim Southee became the leading wicket-taker in men's T20Is, taking his tally to 3 more than Shakib Al Hasan's 122.
This is the first time New Zealand managed to post 200 runs in a T20 World Cup match.
Key Match Events: New Zealand defeated Australia by 89 runs in Sydney on Saturday.
Devon Conway hit a match-winning 92 not out for New Zealand.
Tim Southee picked up 3 wickets, including that of David Warner and Mitchell Marsh, while giving away just 6 runs.
Mitchell Santner picked up 3 wickets, breaking the back of the Australian batting unit.
Australia were bundled out for 111 in just 17.1 overs.
